title: France tops England 2-1 to advance to World Cup semifinals
description: AL KHOR, Qatar — Kylian Mbappe and France made it back to the semifinals of the World Cup on Saturday by beating England 2-1.

title: 'We made history’: Worldwide celebrations explode after Morocco reaches World Cup semifinals
description: Massive crowds from Casablanca to London united in celebration after Morocco’s stunning 1-0 win over Portugal. Morocco is now the first African nation to make it to a World Cup semi-final.

title: Charity suspends work over 'safety concerns' after founder's racist incident with Prince William's godmother

title: Nobel Peace Prize winners blast Putin’s invasion of Ukraine

title: U.S. soccer journalist Grant Wahl dies while covering World Cup match in Qatar
description: Grant Wahl, a longtime soccer sportswriter, died Friday in Qatar while covering the World Cup.

title: Hong Kong jails pro-democracy media tycoon over fraud
description: A Hong Kong court sentenced a pro-democracy media tycoon to five years and nine months in prison on Saturday over two fraud charges linked to lease violations,

title: Morocco's FIFA run unites the Arab world
description: Morocco's men's soccer team shocked the world with their dramatic penalty shootout victory over previous World Cup winner Spain. NBC News’ Gadi Schwartz reports on how the team is now carrying on the hopes of an entire region.

title: As TikToks about Antarctic tourism go viral, some worry about the environmental costs

title: Brittney Griner back in U.S. after Russian imprisonment
description: WNBA star Brittney Griner is back in the U.S., touching down in Texas where military doctors will check her physical and mental health and where she reunited with her wife Cherelle. NBC News’ Andrea Mitchell has more details on the prisoner swap.
